answers.author: Laurie Faith Gibson
answers.text:
At the City of Elgin, Illinois.  Residents have an oppertunity for public comments during the City Council meeting.  They sign up on a sheet between the comity of the whole and the regular council meeting and have up to 3 minutes to talk on a topic not currently on the vote agenda. 
This section of the agenda is called "Recognized Persons Present" and the total time allotted to all speakers signed in may not exceed 30 minutes total, any overage is at the discretion of the Mayor.

answers.author: Michael Smith
answers.text:
The City of Oklahoma City allows citizens to comment in all public meetings with a few guidelines.  The following is an example of the guidelines for a City Council meeting.
Citizens may address the Council during public hearings on any agenda item, such as dilapidated housing, planning, and zoning decisions, but all comments must be relevant to the item. Citizens may also address the Council on individual concerns at the end of the agenda when the Mayor announces "Citizens to be Heard."  Citizens to be Heard is not provided as a forum for publicly announced or declared candidates for City public
office, and they will not be allowed to speak as Citizens to be Heard. Citizens will not be allowed to campaign on any political issue during the Council meeting. Please fill out a "Request to be Heard" form located outside the Chambers. Please return this form to the Council Office at the north end of the hall. PLEASE LIMIT YOUR COMMENTS TO 3 MINUTES.
Citizens who wish to be listed on the agenda for comments to Council may call the City Clerk's Office before 4 p.m. on the Tuesday prior to the next Council meeting. Persons so listed on the agenda for comments to Council are subject to the same restriction listed above.

answers.author: Robert Kiely
answers.text:
Toni, the City of Lake Forest offers mutliple opportunities for public comment. Early on the agenda we offer an opportunity for public comment on "non-agenda items". Then under each agenda item the chair will ask if there is any comments on the particular topic under consideration. In all cases we have "Public Comment Rules" which limit comments to four minutes, not redundant of other speakers, etc. I would be happy to send you the rules if you are interested.

answers.author: Mike Cohen
answers.text:
A growing number of local governments are using online public comment forums that are designed to augment and diversify the residents that participate in public hearings.
Though online participation does not directly address your question, it might be helpful to note that these online public comment forums also can be used to complement a local government's conventional public comments process. 
To learn more, go to www.OpenTownHall.com .

author: Toni Shope
text:
North Carolina has a law that requires at least 1 comment period a month for the public. A locality is trying to find out how other communities conduct their public comment period during their meetings. Is it before the meeting starts in a open forum?  If so for how long?  If it prior to the consent agenda items? Or at the end of the meeting?
Please share and provide the structure of how that takes place.
title: Public Comment During Meetings
